channel.title: Compiler Problem
channel.description:
I try to load up my compiler and it come's up with this.. Just as i was about to release my rsps. There's always problems.
javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .
My compiler.
@echo off "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.7.0_40\bin\javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src\server\event\*.java src\server\model\items\*.java src\server\model\minigames\*.java src\server\model\npcs\*.java src\server\model\objects\*.java src\server\model\players\*.java src\server\model\players\skills\*.java src\server\model\players\packets\*.java src\server\model\shops\*.java src\server\net\*.java src\server\task\*.java src\server\util\*.java src\server\world\*.java src\server\util\log\*.java src\server\*.java src\server\world\map\*.java pause
Source and client locations. [img]http://i.imgur.com/OxMiPjh.png[/img] Any help?

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

runescape sucks:

I think they cheated a bit. Kinda like “Hey count to 40!” “One two… skip a few… forty!”

They did… Like big time:

[quote=“Wikipedia”]Java SE 7
Java SE 7 Update 1
Java SE 7 Update 2
Java SE 7 Update 3
Java SE 7 Update 4
Java SE 7 Update 5
Java SE 7 Update 6
Java SE 7 Update 7
Java SE 7 Update 9
Java SE 7 Update 10
Java SE 7 Update 11
Java SE 7 Update 13
Java SE 7 Update 15
Java SE 7 Update 17
Java SE 7 Update 21
Java SE 7 Update 25
Java SE 7 Update 40[/quote]
Link: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_version_history#Java_7_updates

Anyways, OP. The compiler cannot find files in the following directory: src\server\event
Either, you messed up the compiler, don’t have the correct jdk path, or that directory isn’t there (or files are missing)
You can get an IDE to sort this out, or you can manually fix the compiler (I’d go with an ide to be honest).

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

I think they cheated a bit. Kinda like “Hey count to 40!” “One two… skip a few… forty!”

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:6, topic:533115”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=651908.msg4370062#msg4370062 date=1380419346]
jdk1.7.0_40 doesn’t exist, its probably near 30 lol

Search for your java installation folder, in program files or program files (x86) and see what version you have.
Change it to that one.
Also change the x86 path to just program files, if it was in there
[/quote]
Actually, jdk1.7.0.40 is the newest version. I had to download it today.

The problem can be simply solved by doing what Strucker said. Use an IDE. The most common(to my knowledge) is Eclipse.[/quote]
thefuck they’re at 40 already o.o

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @runescape_sucks runescape sucks
item.description:
@runescape_sucks wrote:

[quote=“RandQm, post:5, topic:533115”]jdk1.7.0_40 doesn’t exist, its probably near 30 lol

Search for your java installation folder, in program files or program files (x86) and see what version you have.
Change it to that one.
Also change the x86 path to just program files, if it was in there[/quote]
Actually, jdk1.7.0.40 is the newest version. I had to download it today.

The problem can be simply solved by doing what Strucker said. Use an IDE. The most common(to my knowledge) is Eclipse.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

jdk1.7.0_40 doesn’t exist, its probably near 30 lol

Search for your java installation folder, in program files or program files (x86) and see what version you have.
Change it to that one.
Also change the x86 path to just program files, if it was in there

Read full topic

item.description:
@strucker wrote:

I’d recommend you using an ide, you wouldnt be running this shit problems.

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @Pogle Pogle
item.description:
@Pogle wrote:

@echo off "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/jdk1.7.0_40/bin/javac.exe" -classpath deps/log4j-1.2.15.jar;deps/jython.jar;deps/xstream.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/poi.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar -d bin src/server/event/*.java src/server/model/items/*.java src/server/model/minigames/*.java src/server/model/npcs/*.java src/server/model/objects/*.java src/server/model/players/*.java src/server/model/players/skills/*.java src/server/model/players/packets/*.java src/server/model/shops/*.java src/server/net/*.java src/server/task/*.java src/server/util/*.java src/server/world/*.java src/server/util/log/*.java src/server/*.java src/server/world/map/*.java pause

javac: file not found: src\server\event\*.java Usage: javac use -help for a list of possible options Press any key to continue . . .

Still the same error and i’ve changed all the \ to /'s

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Problem
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Change all of \ to / in your compiler.

Read full topic
